title: Swinging Arm - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency that may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Make sure that the brake pipes or hoses do not become bent or kinked during assembly.
Bent or kinked brake pipes can cause a reduction in braking efficiency.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Release the brake hose clips from the swinging arm and secure the rear brake caliper to one side.
Remove the left and right hand swinging arm spindle finishers.

body.name: Rear Brake line clip onto swinging arm_TD1_markup

body.body: Undo and remove the lock nut.
Remove the rear suspension unit lower mounting bolt.
Remove the swinging arm spindle lock nut and washer. Discard the lock nut.
Partially withdraw the swinging arm spindle from the right hand side, to allow access to the swinging arm adjuster sleeve located on the left hand side of the frame.
in the slots of the frame adjuster sleeve and rotate anticlockwise to loosen the sleeve fully.
Protect the drive chain from contamination during removal of the swinging arm.
Make sure brake lines, harnesses and hoses are not damaged during removal of the swinging arm.
Withdraw the swinging arm spindle from the right hand side and remove the swinging arm.
Check the drive chain rubbing strip for damage or wear and replace as necessary.
